body:
Marvel Theory:

What if Captain Marvel is somehow responsible for Nick Fury losing an eye?

“Last time I trusted someone I lost an eye.”

It would explain why he didn’t call her in before, too - if he was so angry at her that she was an absolute last resort.

(This is just a theory, be gentle with me as I haven’t read any of the comics).

title: #3: It Must Be the Girl
body:
We read a small handful of comics covering the story of the explosion that gives Carol her powers. Spoiler alert: it’s a little anti-climactic. Topics of discussion include Batman, Rick Jones, whether or not Carol inherited Mar-Vell’s powers, platonically swapping DNA, and the Mystery of Zo. Join us for reading the 1968 Captain Marvel #15-18, plus a little discussion on the 2012 Captain Marvel #1 and #3, and The Mighty Captain Marvel #0!


Check out this episode!

title: Octoween #2: Ms. Marvel (Carol Danvers)
body:
Hey Gang!

Can I just Say I am so proud of myself? I have six costumes with the same wig! The Cape is used on three of the costumes I had planned for the month. I think I did a good job of getting pieces I was going to be able to use over and over again. I was thinking about actually sewing a lightning bolt on Ms. Marvel, But I wanted to use it again, so I’m going to make it in felt. In the mean time, enjoy this super crude photoshop.



This costume consists of the same wig for She-Ra, A Red sash I had laying around the house, and a halter body suit I got from Amazon.



Are you dressing up for the month? Let’s Chat about it on Twitter!

Instagram | Goodreads | Facebook | Youtube | Bloglovin’

Same Bat Time, Same Bat Channel,

summary: Illuminated Empire begins Here  My other projects: >MAD MAGIC< >Heromaker (on Tapas)<[[MORE]] Anon: Would Marvel and comics in...
caption:
Illuminated Empire begins Here

My other projects: >MAD MAGIC< >Heromaker (on Tapas)<

Anon: Would Marvel and comics in general be better if it was run like manga?

If run like manga you mean “more content at a better priece and more wildly available”, yeah sure.

If run like manga you mean one creator and a set of editors driving a story forward until it runs its natural course and/or it doesn’t make money anymore, then that’s more a creator owned indie thing. Despite what everyone says, I believe continuity and the character persisting across different interpretations is one of the strenghts and reasons of appeal of superheroes and other shared universes in general.

Anon: Reddit actually was surprisingly supportive. There were the usual dissenting voices but they didn’t add anything substantial. Just dumb comments like “wow stop ranting like a child” etc. You really let out the flood gates there. I’ve never seen so many rants against the direction Carol was taking in the past few years. Everyone usually acts super polite and stay optimistic that marvel won’t fuck it up. No one goes on a full blown rant like you did. It was a wakeup call.

Good to hear I guess. I know this is superhero comics and I know stuff like this happens all the times, and I know I’m not the first person screeching about it like this, but hey, it was the last straw.

Anon: I’m very tired so I haven’t been through your entire thing about Life of Captain Marvel but THANK YOU. I can’t stand it. The “empowerment” no! Just! Marvel had the opportunity to give us subtle insidious sexim. To tell the lives of SO MANY girls. That women could all band together and be like “omg this is the stuff I deal/dealt with” and watch how Carol struggled and overcame and still struggles but we love hrr anyway. I’m so disappointed and it’s nice to know I’m not alone.

Thanks. Your reply reminds me of yet ANOTHER point I should’ve addressed  about these retcons: originally, in the Claremont’s issues Carol worked a part time job for two years, saving up money, but still coming up short. Her father’s help was the last hope for her to get an education, but not finding any help, she takes destiny in her own hands and joins the military.In Stohl’s new version, Carol DIDN’T get a part time job, just asks for money, and then her mother secretly pays for her tuition. So Carol moves from being a driven girl full of purpose and ambition struggling to get the things she wants, to some chick that just sorta falls into success by doing nothing on her own.

Anon:  No, i meant Hulk’s noses. The thing to breath with. I specified males because all She-Hulks have normal face proportions.

I still don’t know what you want me to tell you.
caption_abstract:
Illuminated Empire begins Here

My other projects: >MAD MAGIC< >Heromaker (on Tapas)<

title: tony stark is not god no matter what peter parker may think - livingtheobsessedlife - Multifandom [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies), The Avengers (Marvel) - All Media Types, Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Avengers infinity war - Fandom
Rating: General Audiences
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Peter Parker & Tony Stark, background Carol Danvers/James Rhodes - Relationship, background Natasha Romanoff/Maria Hill, Background Steve Rogers/Tony Stark - Relationship, Background Clint Barton/Phil Coulson - Relationship
Characters: Peter Parker, Tony Stark, Steve Rogers, Sam Wilson (Marvel), Maria Hill, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Bruce Banner, Clint Barton, Carol Danvers, James Rhodes, May Parker (Spider-Man), Mary Jane Watson, Ned Leeds

Summary:

Peter always considered himself an atheist, except for when it comes to Tony Stark apparently

- - - -

Peter just freezes where he stands, confused, “Shawarma?”

“Yep.”

Peter always considered himself an atheist, except for when it comes to Tony Stark apparently

- - - -

Peter just freezes where he stands, confused, “Shawarma?”

“Yep.”
